div.head: Richard Midgly Will
div.p:
November 18th, 1676 In the name of God Amen I Richard Midgly of
Charles County in the province of Maryland being at present very sick & weak of body
but of sound & perfect memory, and knowing the uncertainty of this transitory Life
for such one Estate as it hath Please the almighty God to bestow upon me I am
willing to disperse of it in manner & form of following-

I doo bequeath my soul unto the Almighty God that gave it me & by the merits
of my beloved savioru Jesus Christ for to be saved I hereby next my body unto the Earth
from were it came there to be Handsomly & decently Buried in Christian manner

Secondly. It is my whole will & desire that all my goods & Chattles that can be lawfully proved
mine my be brough into an appointment and alsoe that all such Debts as can
bee lawfully made appear for to be d from me bee fully satisfied & paid out
of my said Estate

Thirdly It my will & desire that the plantation & land that are belonging which
I did leese of Mr. Matthew Stone be sold for wheat.

Fourthly It is my will & desire that after all my Just Debts is paid I do fully & bequeath
unto
unto my wife Elizabeth Midgly to her heis Executors Aministrators
and and half of my Estate clare of all Charges only if that it be
the pleasure of almighty good tht I shall dee my wife for to pay for
half my funeral charges & also the other half of my estate I doe fully
give unto John Hanson to him Executors Administrators &
forever the said John Hanson for to make the most of my Estate and toe
see that my wife Elizabeth Midgly neither of my Creditors bee not depraved
of what is their just doo.

Fifthly. I doe give unto Elizabeth Midgly my wife a mayd servant named Bellsie
Clark & also my chest & unto my Brother in law Thomas Luger my
& pistall I doe utterly revoke all former wills made by me and doe affirm
this for to be my last will and testament as witness my hand & seal this
day and year above written

witnessed by
Ed. Maddock-Lewis I. Jones
sign

On the back of the aforegoing will was the following probit (to will)
December 22d day 1676 Lewis Hones Being sworn sayth that he did see the
within mentioned Richard Midgly sign seal and publish this within mentioned
will and finder saith not-as witness
4 1/4 sides
John Stone
